title: Steve Spurrier reportedly retiring
text:
/ Headlines List / Article 
South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier is retiring. The story was first reported by Thayer Evans of Sports Illustrated. 
Spurrier is in his 11th year at South Carolina and had put together three straight 11-win seasons. But the Gamecocks slipped to 7-6 last year and are off to a 2-4 start this season with all four loses in the SEC. 
Spurrier coached Florida for 12 seasons and won the 1996 national championship. He left college football to coach the NFL’s Washington Redskins but went 12–20 in two seasons before returning to the SEC at South Carolina. 
Spurrier is 70 years old. Reports said his retirement is effective immediately and an interim coach will be named Wednesday.
